channel.title: Compiler not working? - iClarity
channel.description:
Ok so my Compiler isn't working and I want to know why. Below is what I have in my compiler.
[code]@echo off title Compiler cd ../src echo Compiling iClarity.rs2 "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../bin/ ./iClarity/rs2/*.java echo Compiling iClarity.rs2.io.packets "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../bin/ ./iClarity/rs2/io/packets/*.java echo Compiling iClarity.rs2.npcs "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../bin/ ./iClarity/rs2/npcs/*.java echo Compiling iClarity.rs2.players "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../bin/ ./iClarity/rs2/players/*.java echo Compiling iClarity.rs2.util "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../bin/ ./iClarity/rs2/util/*.java echo Compiling iClarity.rs2.world "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../bin/ ./iClarity/rs2/world/*.java echo Compiling completed. pause [/code]
When I compile This is my error: [code]The system cannot find the path specified. Compiling iClarity.rs2 javac: file not found: .\iClarity\rs2\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Compiling iClarity.rs2.io.packets javac: file not found: .\iClarity\rs2\io\packets\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Compiling iClarity.rs2.npcs javac: file not found: .\iClarity\rs2\npcs\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Compiling iClarity.rs2.players javac: file not found: .\iClarity\rs2\players\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Compiling iClarity.rs2.util javac: file not found: .\iClarity\rs2\util\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Compiling iClarity.rs2.world javac: file not found: .\iClarity\rs2\world\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Compiling completed. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Obviously I'm not doing something right. This is my first time using a packaged server.

item.title: Compiler not working? - iClarity
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote="Jamie1200, post:4, topic:397124"]File paths are wrong. Were is your .bat file in comparison to your folder files?[/quote] My Compiler: @echo off title Building... cd ../src echo Compiling iClarity.rs2 "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../bin/ ./iClarity/rs2/*.java echo Compiling iClarity.rs2.io.packets "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../bin/ ./iClarity/rs2/io/packets/*.java echo Compiling iClarity.rs2.npcs "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../bin/ ./iClarity/rs2/npcs/*.java echo Compiling iClarity.rs2.players "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../bin/ ./iClarity/rs2/players/*.java echo Compiling iClarity.rs2.util "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../bin/ ./iClarity/rs2/util/*.java echo Compiling iClarity.rs2.world "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../bin/ ./iClarity/rs2/world/*.java echo Compiling completed. pause
And my folders are:

bin
and in bin there is: Data, and iClarity
in Data there is Config, DATFiles, and GameSaves
in iClarity there is rs2
in rs2 there is io, npcs, packets, players, util, and world
in io there is packets
packets doesn’t have any folders
npcs, packets, players, util, and world don’t have any folders

Ok and in the folder io, the folder named packets has the files Buttons and ObjectOption1, and in the packets folder not in io it has the same files. Why? Do I need the ones in io?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler not working? - iClarity
item.dc:creator: @Marine5287 Marine5287
item.description:
@Marine5287 wrote:

Dclawrushz:

I can help you on TeamViewer!

When people say this, it eliminates the help of another person that is doing the right thing and using the search bar. Please try helping in the thread so other people can learn.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler not working? - iClarity
item.dc:creator: @ApocalypseX ApocalypseX
item.description:
@ApocalypseX wrote:

Change

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe"

To

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javaw.exe"

and if that doesn’t work, try this one:

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\java.exe"

Hope this helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler not working? - iClarity
